alert.note: Alert for Madison; Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:35PM CST until January 26 at 9:37PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Madison and Walker Counties. For the Bedias Creek...including Madisonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bedias Creek near Madisonville. * WHEN...From this evening to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 19.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 10/19/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Bedias Creek Madisonvill 19.0 18.9 Wed 7 pm CST 19.6 18.1 14.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 245 PM CST.
